Ensuring the safety and security of passengers is a crucial factor in promoting public transportation in suburban areas. Some ways to achieve this can include:

1. Employing well-trained drivers and staff who prioritize passenger safety and are equipped to handle emergencies.

2. Installing surveillance cameras on buses and at stations to deter potential crimes and provide a means of identifying offenders.

3. Engaging with local law enforcement agencies to provide a visible presence and offer additional security measures.

4. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of vehicles and infrastructure to ensure that they meet safety standards and are in good working order.

In addition to ensuring safety and security, several initiatives can be implemented to make the public transportation system in suburban areas more dependable and punctual. These initiatives can include:

1. Implementing real-time tracking and notification systems to keep passengers informed of delays or changes to schedules.

2. Investing in more buses or trains to increase the frequency of services and decrease the likelihood of overcrowding.

3. Providing comfortable waiting areas with amenities such as seating, Wi-Fi and charging ports.

4. Partnering with other transportation providers to create a more comprehensive transportation network that provides greater accessibility and convenience to passengers.

Some cities have already implemented such initiatives, such as New York City's MTA Bus Time real-time tracking system and London's Transport for London initiative to invest in new buses with improved reliability and low-emission technologies.
